results.title: Looking at Puffing Billy
results.brief_description: An enthusiasts video production about the Puffing Billy railway beginning with a brief history of the line, its relatively recent retoration, and the work of the Puffing Bily Preservation Society. We are taken on a detailed trip along the line from Belgrave to Emerald Lake.

results.title: Artwork design
results.brief_description: Shows how a rough sketch of a circuit proceeds through definite stages to master art work from which a circuit board can later be made.

results.title: Theatre: getting your act together
results.brief_description: Presents a behind-the-scenes look at the theatre and the roles of the playwright, director, actor and theatre production staff. Designed to promote students’ interest in the theatre and to provide them with an insight into the workings of two professional theatre companies - The Melbourne Theatre Company and Sydney’s King O’Malley Theatre Company. The program is divided into five sections: 1 What is theatre? 2 The playwright in society. 3 In rehearsal. 4 The performance. 5 Theatre in society.

results.title: The Youth who wanted to shiver
results.creator_credit: Sam Weiss, C B Wismar, Nick Bosustow, Acton Films and Bosustow Entertainment

video_links.name: The Youth who wanted to shiver

results.brief_description: An animated adaptation of the classic fairy tale by the Brothers Grimm, about Jack who knows no fear and wants to be able to shiver. All help fails until his bride pours a bucket of tiny fish over him.

results.title: Fisherman & his wife: a Grimm's fairy tale
results.creator_credit: Sam Weiss, C B Wismar, Nick Bosustow, Churchill Films and Bosustow Entertainment

video_links.name: Fisherman & his wife: a Grimm's fairy tale

results.brief_description: A Grimm’s fairy tale about a humble fisherman who frees a prince from a spell. The fisherman’s wife siezes the opportunity to have all her wishes granted but ends up where she started, thus learning a bitter lesson.

results.title: Red Nightmare
results.creator_credit: George Waggner, William L. Hendricks, United States. Dept. of Defense and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: An anti communist drama sponsored by the U.S Government, supervised by Jack L. Warner and produced during the Cold War. The drama revolves around a small town American who takes his civil liberties for granted until he dreams of a communist takeover which jolts him out of his complacency. Narrated by Jack Webb. Photographed by Robert Hoffman. Written by Vincent Fotre. Music by William Lava. Edited by Folmer Blargsted. Starring Jack Kelly, Jeanne Cooper, Andrew Duggan, Peter Brown, Patricia Woodell, Peter Breck, Robert Conrad, Mike Road.

results.title: In the beginning
results.brief_description: A colourful clay animation film which satirizes society and its impulse to invent nuclear weapons which cause self-destruction. Looks at the invention of destructive weapons from raspberries to rockets! Narration: Brian Woods. Animation: Mark D’Arcy-Irvine, Masfufah Sani. Suitable for lower secondary level.

results.title: Billabong
results.brief_description: Set among the red gums, this film captures the mood of one day on the Murray River, Echuca, Victoria. Shows where thousands of birds come to breed each year.

results.creator_credit: Deakin University, Michael Rogers and Weston Bate

results.title: The Dam builders
results.creator_credit: Melbourne and Metropolitan Board of Works and Cine Service
results.brief_description: Gives a brief history of the Melbourne water supply system and the efforts of the MMBW to create enjoyable environments such as landscaping and recreation facilities in several catchment areas. Highlights the construction of the Cardinia Reservoir, near Emerald, now the largest storage area for Melbourne.
